title: Frank de Boer reveals he rejected offer to take over at Liverpool in 2012
text:
Sport Frank de Boer reveals he rejected offer to take over at Liverpool in 2012 The Dutchman also turned down Newcastle in 2015 but insists he wants to try his luck in the Premier League Share De Boer turned down Liverpool when Kenny Dalglish left (Photo: Getty Images) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Dutch legend Frank de Boer has revealed that he turned down an offer to take charge of Liverpool in 2012 - but he would love to one day manage in the Premier League. 
The former Ajax and Barcelona defender turned his hand to management after hanging up his boots in 2006, winning four consecutive titles from 2011-14 with Ajax and reaching the World Cup final as Netherlands assistant manager. 
And the 46-year-old has revealed that Liverpool, who were seeking a boss following the departure of Kenny Dalglish in 2012, reached out to him. 
"I would love to manage here," De Boer told the Daily Mail , "but the project has to be right. I told Liverpool I was honoured but I was only one year in at Ajax, it was too soon. I needed to achieve more, and I did." De Boer won four Dutch titles in a row at Ajax (Photo: Getty) The Reds opted for Brendan Rodgers (Photo: Ben Hoskins/Getty) 
The Reds instead opted for Swansea boss Brendan Rodgers. 
De Boer quit his role at Ajax at the end of last season to take the top job at Inter Milan - but would only last 85 days before given the boot in November. 
He admits that he was relishing a new challenge in Serie A, but external pressures ground him down. Inter Milan manager Frank De Boer (Photo: Sunday Mail) 
"Leaving Ajax after 25 years as player, coach and manager was hard, but sometimes you are saying the same things, you need a new challenge, like Pep," De Boer continued. 
"But at Inter I had to deal with so many things away from football, you lose energy. 
"Every time you thought, "Finally, a good result, everything has calmed down", then comes Mauro Icardi's book (in which the captain criticised the club's Ultras) or Marcelo Brozovic is in the discotheque and you have to punish him. We only had three months but honestly, it felt like a year."
